data.title: Polish History Museum in Warsaw
data.meta_description: Feel invited to visit our Reading Room open to the public that can be found behind the main hall on the ground floor and use the electronic catalogue of our library collections. In the Reading Room, the guests can use our Wi-Fi network and their own laptops. There are also comfortable desks, armchairs and poufs available.
data.text:
We invite you to use the Library of the Polish History Museum soon

Electronic catalogue: http://biblioteka.muzhp.pl/

At the moment, the Museum’s book collection comprises approximately eight thousand volumes and is still expanding. Most books are freely accessible for the readers.

We primarily collect literature related to Poland’s history, as well as publications from different fields of the humanities such as: archaeology, ethnography, philosophy, history of culture, art history, world history, and religious studies.

In our Library, the reader will also find a large selection of richly illustrated albums and catalogues of exhibitions, varsaviana, diaries, memoirs, reportages, interesting feature writing, popular-science books for children and youth, comic books, as well as board games.

Please note that book rental is available for employees and collaborators of the Polish History Museum only.

You are welcome!
